author: {'steamid': '76561198085367707', 'num_games_owned': 779, 'num_reviews': 373, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1594626823}
review:
Negligee Love Stories é um visual novel com conteúdo adulto que ficou famoso por ter sido o jogo que abriu as porteiras para títulos com conteúdo sexual explicito na Steam, sendo basicamente o primeiro a ser admitido na plataforma com esse tipo de conteúdo.

O jogo tem seus momentos picantes, mas vai além do que apenas ser uma pornografia escrita e apresenta quatro contos separados, cada um com personagens próprios e múltiplos finais que seguem de acordo com as escolhas do jogador, todos eles muito bem escritos e interessantes.

Os contos são seguidos pela perspectiva de um personagem feminino, mas as coisas podem esquentar muito rápido, dependendo da maneira como você resolver jogar, muito embora o jogo estranhamente siga uma linha mais moralista que tende a punir decisões mais safadas com um final não muito feliz.

O chato é que apesar de existirem muitas decisões a serem tomadas e alguns finais diferentes a serem alcançados, a narrativa parece não se alterar em quase nada, independentemente do caminho escolhido, e assim sendo, só mudam mesmo as beiradas, mas o recheio continua praticamente inalterado, com uma ou outra frase diferente, sem nem sequer uma imagem nova.

Isso é ruim por dois motivos, primeiro porque tira um pouco a graça de jogar o jogo novamente, já que não verá nada de novo se não o próprio final; segundo é que mesmo que você queira jogar de novo, como as decisões não mostram seus impactos, é difícil saber quais as escolhas necessárias para conduzi-lo a um final diferente.

E considerando o estilo do jogo, também pode ser considerado negativo o fato de a caixa de texto ser muito escura e não haver forma de ajustar sua transparência, tornando impossível em, alguns momentos, visualizar a imagem por baixo dela. Ainda mais que ela cisma em sempre ficar encima de alguma parte interessante.

No geral, Negligee Love Stories é interessante e soube aproveitar seu apelo sexual sem deixar de lado a criação dos personagens e o desenvolvimento de uma boa narrativa. Como uma visual novel, é sim um bom jogo, mas se você quer apenas put4ria, hoje em dia já existem na Steam jogos mais indicados a sua necessidade. BOM (7/10).

review: Negligee and Love Stories are about as perfect as Dharker Studios gets, and that is not intended in a negative way. I'm fairly shocked, admittedly. Their library consists of aesthetically pleasing novels, usually at the cost of any compelling narrative, stand out characters, and adequate translations. However, the Negligee titles went against the standard that had been built for me. The visual style was nailed once again, an understandable and surprisingly important plot was present, characterization support and character exploration shined through extensively. I have to give credit, for yet another novel that I had acquired through the summer sale has subverted my expectations. What can I say? It practically screamed "masturbatory material". Once more, I am proven thoroughly mistaken. I highly suggest/advise playing the adult versions of the game. Steam released an all-ages equivalent and that saw significantly poor reception. I mean, cause why not actually learn something about the women and their lives, whilst sexually admiring them simultaneously? It felt relieving to finally finish this game. I've been increasingly preoccupied, as of recent, but hope to get around to completing more novels and subsequently releasing their reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055301588', 'num_games_owned': 1098, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1554035625}
review:
[h1] Negligee : Love Stories ▸ Écrit[/h1]

Bon bon, Negligee : Love Stories. Premier titre non censuré de la plateforme. A dire vrai, je m’attendais à un visual novel assez mature et avec des scènes adultes pertinentes et des histoires intéressantes.

Malheureusement, ce n’est pas le cas. Negligee : Love Stories est un concentré de clichés & de fantasmes que hommes ou femmes pourraient avoir. A en juger par la devanture de Dharker Studio, c’est dans leurs habitudes de produire des contenus de ce genre. Enfin c’est tellement cliché et pauvre narrativement que j’en suis venu à augmenter la vitesse des dialogues et des transitions pour que je puisse lire sans perdre de temps. C’est dommage d’ailleurs parce qu’il faut avouer que j’ai tout de même apprécier certains rebondissements. Enfin il s’en est passé des choses pour les employées de Negligee sans rire. 

Quand j’ai vu le titre accompagné de “Love Stories”, je me doutais bien entendu que ce serait prétexte à du contenu sexuel à tout va. J’ai pris le risque j’avoue et puis il y a quelques points où le jeu est vraiment intéressant… Notamment le ressenti des personnages ainsi que les dessins. Pour le coup j’ai pas grand chose à redire sur ça.

Mais rentrons un peu dans le détail tout de même. Ce titre vous permet de vivre une partie de la vie de 4 futures employées de Negligee. Des vies bien clichées il faut l’avouer mais pourquoi pas… :
[list]
[*] Karen, mariée avec un homme qui ne la regarde plus et qui trouve du réconfort avec un autre.
[*] Jasmin, strip teaseuse révoltée à l’idée d’être une prostituée et qui pourtant en vient à accepter d’être filmée et prise en photo pour un film de boule.
[*] Charlotte, qui doit avoir l’histoire la plus cute à mes yeux et qui ne sait pas où vraiment situer son amour. Un peu timide sur les bords. Un peu moe finalement.
[*] Sophie, une addicte au sexe dont l’histoire déraille quelque peu. 
[/list]
Avec cet épisode, Dharker Studio joue beaucoup sur le “fantasme du viol” notamment dans l’histoire de Sophie...

Un point qui est cependant appréciable, c’est le fait qu’il y ait des épilogues. Et que ces épilogues sont réellement faits dans le but d’ajouter du background. A contrario, les musiques sont redondantes et pas vraiment plaisantes...

Cependant, ça ne change en rien le fait que Negligee : Love Stories est basée sur des fantasmes  et que les histoires en deviennent fades de banalité malgré quelques rebondissements. Sans compter le fait que les “choix” n’ont jamais vraiment de grosses incidence à part le fait de changer quelque peu la fin de l’histoire de ladite personne. 

Enfin, ça reste un eroge... Je suis peut être un peu sévère :p

author: {'steamid': '76561197970898913', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1540038475}
review:
I think a lot of negativity about this game came from misconceptions about what it is and people approaching it without having played the original Negligee. First, this is a nukige, so you should expect the porn to come before the story and honestly, things are more balanced here and the scenarios more elaborate than in most VNs of this kind. Second, it's a prequel, supplementing the original story and expanding on the characters featured there - while Negligee is not a particularly deep game, it gives you enough context to make reading the backstories featured here more interesting.

There are obviously some issues here, like the choices often being meaningless apart from contributing to what ending you're gonna get, or some scenarios (especially in Sophie's episode) being over-the-top/plain stupid. In general, I find the writing here decent, a bit above that of the original game - there's a bit more effort to tell actual stories here and give characters a bit of depth. It's also, just as the first Negligee, quite impressive when it goes to visuals - there are relatively few Western erotic VNs that look this good and it definitely matters in this kind of game.

In the end, I would recommend this mostly to people that played and enjoyed the first game - both titles supplement each other quite well and create an enjoyable experience together. As a standalone title, it's probably not worth it, unless you're just looking for quality hentai scenes. Also, both Negligee games are a bit pricey for the amount of content they offer - it's probably a better idea to grab them on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095802014', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1595617872}
review:
If you have not played the first game the chances of you enjoying this are slim because all of the main characters are reused from the last game and no context is given. However, it is a prequel so it doesn't necessarily need to be explained, but you don't need to have played the first game, you'll just get more enjoyment if you have. This game is all about the somewhat... interesting pasts of the three girls that go to work at Negligee in the first game, Sophie, Jasmine, and Charlotte, and the original manager Karen. Since there are four different characters each one has a seperate story focusing on them. So I will section this review into a few parts, a story review, an art review, replayability, and then finally give some thoughts as to wether or not you should buy this. 

- The Story -
The first story you are going to play is Karen's. She's in an unfaithful marriage to a man who married her because her dad was his boss at the company he worked at. The marriage is very unhappy and because of this Karen falls to some tempations. This story has three endings, giving it more replay value than the last two. However, one of the endings is hilariously fast and forced with no hints as to why it happened. I legitimately found myself (like a terrible person) laughing at the absurdity of it. Crime is a serious topic and to see it adressed in such a light especailly in a game like this where it was not advertised, and you would not think it happens from the first game is surprising. 
The second story of the game focuses on Jasmine, one of the three main girls from the original game. As she said in the first game she's working a job at a strip club. However her boss tells her to think about her future and then she does. This leads to two different encounters you will have which you can choose to be sexual with or almost completely ignore. This is the second and last story with three endings. The good ending is definitely heart warming since you could see in the first game that Jasmine was a good person. Of course, for anyone who wants it the other two endings are a bit more... not so heart warming. However if you want to see Jasmin pretty much become a prostitute go ahead, you can do that. 
The third story is about Charlotte, and how she needs to come to terms about how she's lesbian. To be honest this was definitely the shortest and weakest part of the game. Most of the cgs were reused and only slightly changed and was light to compared to the other sections. The story only has two endings making it feel a bit bland and you only get three choices throughout the path. The value of this story will completely go over your head unless you played the first game, or like to see a yuri lesbian become a true lesbian. 
The fourth story is about Sophie, and well if you played the first game you'd guess this was the wildest one, and you'd be right. Well, the least I can say is this is the polarizing story. If you like your R18 content non vanilla and non consenmsual you will probably enjoy this. However, if you don''t you will probably abhor what you see and be turned off. from this game. This story also only has two endings, and neither of them feel as if they really matter because they basically just both end the same way. 

- The Art -
The art in this game I would say personally is an improvement over the first game. I see more detail in hair and face and since it's uncensored from the get go you could defintely tell Dharker Studio is still trying to figure out how to draw d***s. Since they mostly do Yuri it's annoying that they would even try this because it depreciates the value of the game in my opinion. But other than that an improvement over the first game. It take a highly anime reminiscent art style and I would personally give it an 8/10.

- The Replayability -
If you've played any virtual novel before you know the drill. Make your choices and see if they actually affect the outcome of the story. The only stories that actually have big changes in their endings that make you feel like your choices mattered are the first two. However, while Sophie's story does end in the same way either way Charlotte's doesn't. Overall I would say this is slightly better than most visual novels on Steam in terms of choices. Definitely better than the Sakura games. 

- The Finale -
Thank you for reading through this multi paragraph review of an anime p0rn game on Steam, congrats you can now consider yourself an intellectual. Overall, I would have to say this game is pretty good, wait for a sale however if you can't get behind the art in the trailers. But, I would personally give it a 8 out of 10. It's not the best thing in the world but it's definitely an improvement over what we've seen on Steam so far and it's the first game to be released that is completely uncensored. (Minus Melty's Quest but that was a patch) So if you have an interest in being a sad sad little man and fancy the idea of watching anime chicks get banged (not always in consensual situations), this is probably the game for you. However, if you expect all yuri like the first game you will probably be dissapointed. If you're a die hard fan, Charlotte's story is probably the only one you will want to play, however she does originally start off with a boyfriend so there's always going to be unskippable MaleXFemale action. Time you will spend playing if you do everything: About 2 and a half to 4 hours.
(Ps this is too long for me to proofread so I apologize for any mispellings but yeah I'm lazy but it should still be somewhat understandable and comprehendable.) (PPS. it will only say I have five minutes on the game because I played it offline, however I have all the achievements because I did actually play the game.)

Love Stories nejsou klasická visual novela s jedním velkým příběhem. Místo toho tu jsou čtyři kratší příběhy. Z mého pohledu se jedná spíše o samostatné dlc k původnímu Negligee, neboť nám představuje pozadí postav z této hry. Přes několik zakončení je většina příběhů spíše o tom co postavy prožily před příběhem Negligee. 

Grafika je na velmi dobré úrovni (stejná jako u původního Negligee), hudba netrhá uši. Trošku chybí dabing rozhovorů. Hra je často jmenována v souvislosti s faktem, že se jedná o první necenzurovanou hru na Steamu. Pokud bych měl ale porovna Love stories a Negligee s adult patchem, tak mi přišlo odvážnější původní Negligee. U Love Stories ale máme i mužské charaktery, tak je tohle srovnání mírně neobjektivní.

Pro ty, kterým se původní Negligee líbilo je tahle hra povinností. Samostatně je hra spíše slabší, takže bych se asi rozmýšlel o jejím pořízení pokud nemáte nebo neplánujete koupit i Negligee - rozdělení na 4 jednoduché příběhy je spíše nevýhoda než výhoda vzhledem k plné ceně hry (při slevě minimálně 50% se hra vyplatí i bez původního Negligee).

review:
Before I delve into this too much I want to say that I -only- recommend this game to those of you who have played the previous game before.

Positives:
1.) One of Steam's first uncut games that doesn't need a third party patch! (so glad to be alive in these times)
2.) If you liked the first game then getting the back story on the characters from the first game (minus Hannah and Emily) is quite enjoyable (especially Karen's backstory)
[spoiler] 3.) Charlotte ending back up with Mikka in the epilogue was a wonderful way to end it [/spoiler]
4.) UNCUT VN ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

Negatives:
1.) If you haven't played the first, do not buy this game. As a standalone this game doesn't feel complete enough to really justify the price (maybe if it was 50% off)
2.) (In my opinion) I really do not like how they drew hannah this time around. Why doesn't she look as she did in the first one? Why would they change her character model so much? I understand the time difference, so it made sense during the main story to have her look younger, like she does in this, but during the epilogue look just like the main story? No, I cannot accept that.
3.) The stories do not intertwine at all. There is a slight bit there in the epilogues, but it is so vague that it just feels incomplete. I was really hoping that there was more story connecting this game with the first, but there really isn't.
4.) Lack of artwork... [spoiler] When Chris gets beat up by Johnathan and mentions him wiping blood off his face and getting really beat up. Why don't they make artwork of his character being all bruised and battered and leave it in just text format? It really took away from the experience to get that ending where Chris and Karen run away together and he looks perfectly fine after being beaten near death. [/spoiler]

Overall:
I would have to say this game is average and if there was a middle-ground way of doing a review, I would post it as informational. But in my honest opinion I cannot recommend this game because it just feels like there is not enough heart in it. I appreciate Dharker for making a prequel/sequel, but compaired to the first the story and art seem a little lacking. In the first game there were scenes that had motions (basically short video clips on loop) and I liked that aspect (though I was sad when the quality of it was worse than the quality of the still images, but it was still neat!), I just wish they brought that back for each story line, but it didn't happen.

PS: Love your games Dharker Studios, but I really hope you bring back the video loop element in My Senpai (which I did the Beta access tier in hopes the 3rd is better)

review:
Okay. This is a prequel/sequel to Negligee. The main stories are the prequels, with the epilogues taking place two years after Negligee... oh, and the epilogues of the three love interests seem to imply you chose someone other than that particular one. Now, one of the stories is about Karen, who... was the boss who suddenly quit and left Hannah to run the store in the original Negligee. And well... one of the endings of her story tells you how that happened.

And do note, there are themes in here other than you willingly have sex with this guy (or girl). Some of the routes involve instances where the act has... consent issues. Easiest way to say it, because I can only remember one or two instances where it goes from very weak consent to none at all. At least one of those the girl whacks the offending dude with a lamp, so that scene at least felt somewhat cathartic...

While you don't need to read the original Negligee, I would suggest doing so. Frankly, it is much more satisfying than two of the good endings, and slighty more satisfying than a third (at least if you play Jasmin's route where you don't give into the temptation for money... well money for certain acts). Charlotte's good ending actually feels a bit more satisfying, as it is a true love story... even if it ends slilghtly abruptly [spoiler]but don't worry the epilogue works out well[/spoiler].

Would recommend, but get it on discount and perhaps in a bundle.

review:
So the positives:

2. Artwork. It's japanese style hentai. Nothing wrong here.
3. It's a porn game. It doesn't pretend to be something else.

I finished everything in an hour (including the epilogue). Speed button is not available until after you read through the story the first time. This means a lot of clicking through long dialogues. There are 4 stories to play through, 2 or 3 endings each, and an epilogue. 
2. Story. The stories are heavily into rape, domestic violence (Karen's story), and a lot of moments where you behave like a whore. You're basically playing as one of four women in the game allowing (or not allowing) a man (or woman) to fuck you. That's basically it. 
3. Music. Generic happy music. 
4. CG gallery. While the uncensored images can be beautiful to view, there isn't much packed into the game. 

I was prepared to like this game, but after playing House Party (which I recommend trying out), this is sorely disappointing. Even at 13.99, this is not worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994280880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1537051315}
review:
tl;dr; version:
This is pornography. Make no mistake about that. Unlike the previous game, this one is almost purely hetero-sexual.
And I have to say, I really loved this. Your mileage may vary greatly however, but I don't think I can get into those reasons in a short version.

Long version:
Negligee: Love Stories is a sequel to Negligee, though it happens before the previous game. Uh, does that make it a prequel? Well, whatever. It doesn't seem like I made a review for Negligee, so in short; it was a great game, but it had one glaring flaw. You could end up masturbating in your office which means that you'd miss out on one of the three girls for the rest of the game. That in itself wouldn't be so bad, but this route was clearly not polished properly. The discussions were often just slightly off since one person's dialog wasn't there, and a few key scenes for the plot didn't happen AT ALL. So there was a bad feeling of disconnect if you went that way first, and you probably did since... well... that's the first H scene. Punishing players by having an incomplete route just because they wanted to see the thing they (most likely) most wanted - porn - was NOT a good design. Otherwise, again, it was pretty great all around.

Negligee: Love Stories doesn't fall into the same trap, though possibly because it has been simplified. The game is split into four entirely separate stories, one for each girl. Each story is fairly short, but with four of them, there's still a decent amount of content. Not as much as Negligee I'd think, but getting close-ish. Anyway. There are 3+3+2+2 endings, some of which are NOT nice. At all. Those took me off guard quite badly. If you don't like that, this game might not be for you. Oh, and for the stories with 3 endings, the way to reach one of them tends to be reaaaally specific and non-intuitive, so be prepared to look up a guide for those. After you find the canon ending, the epilogue opens up for that character. These happen AFTER Negligee happens, so Negliee: Love Stories is a... a sequel? Prequel+sequel? Pre-sequel? Well, whatever. Anyway, these are EXTREMELY short and just... cut off. Literally just suddenly end and throw you to the title screen. Umm, would a THE END and/or a fade to black been too much to ask? At least they give a fair amount of closure of what happened after Negligee, I guess.

As for the stories themselves, well, they handle some relatively heavy stuff for a porn game. For example, Jasmin is a stripper. Her story deals with the feelings of shame and guilt, the excuses she makes to keep doing it and her sexuality (as she doesn't really enjoy shaking it for the guys). All the routes tackle something similar; human drama and emotions. Sticking to Jasmin, I find it really refreshing that the storyline isn't just the usual porn storyline of "she's a slut and she loves it" -thing. But if you don't like the idea of a pornographic game handling actual human emotions, well, this game might not be for you. But are the stories REALISTIC realistic? Uuh, I don't know. I don't know any strippers from whom to ask those questions. But all the stories felt authentic to me and none of them overstayed their welcome. So, I can really only give it 9/10 for the plot. Your mileage may vary wildly. Oh, and the only reason why it's not 10/10 is because I opened up Negligee afterwards and refreshed myself of the start of the game; it didn't connect with Love Stories by 100%. It's pretty close, but there are some slight inconsistencies. Yes, I am probably the only person in the whole world who cares and I am proud of it, thank you very much.

Execution wise, the game REALLY could've used some sort of "thought-indicator." There is constantly text where the current heroine of the story has her name-tag showing up, despite not actually talking. The only way you know if they said something out loud or if they were thinking is by seeing if the other party reacts to it or not. Why not just use ( ) to indicate thoughts or something? Meh. Anyway, other than that, no real complaints. Well, there was two typos I noticed, both cases of "your" which should've been "you're." In consecutive lines. Tsk tsk.

As for the porn, the biggest thing that strikes me is that it's pretty much purely hetero-sexual now. Considering how Negligee was purely girl-on-girl action, this is a rather odd choice. I don't mind, but I'd imagine that many previous fans are going to mind quite a lot. And mind you, this is a cast of mainly lesbians. There's going to be emotional baggage that comes after the deed with males. I already mentioned the heavy stuff before, but just as a reminder. Anyway... an annoying flaw is that there's no obvious way to HIDE THE UI. The usual suspects - spacebar, right-mouse button or a UI element (like "X" in a corner or a "Hide" button) - are not there! There's probably a button for it, but damned if knew where! That should be more obvious! I want to have a proper look at the tiddies without going to the main menu and CG section, damn you!

The drawings themselves are drop-dead gorgeous - but of course your preferences may differ. I had to double-check was it the same person working on the art in both Negligee games, and yes, both games credit Kopi Anget. Damn, son. That much progress in just two years? Nice. I tip my hat to you, good sir. As such, I guess my biggest complaint would be the inconsistent amount of CGs used per scene. For example, Jasmin's blowjob scene has a whopping 20 variations to it. Meanwhile, Charlotte's lesbian scene has 5 variations to it - and there certainly was a lack of CG updating on that one! I wonder what happened, was there poor art direction? Or did they not really know the scale of the budget and this Jasmin scene was the first one produced? I don't think we'll ever know, but I hope the devs learned their lessons. Oh, and Hannah has a new sprite which is... just... off. Well, it's not her game (that's Negligee!) so you hardly even see her, thus maybe it was just a matter of not getting used to it.

Music was okay. The only one I really liked was the stripclub beats, but I never disliked any of the background tracks.

And lastly, I guess I should mention that since this game basically pioneered the whole "one-click porn" thing on Steam, not quite everything went as planned. Apparently in the future Dharker Studio will be releasing games as all-ages with free adult-only DLC. This way, all countries will be able to buy the game itself, and those countries where pornography is allowed (read: not Germany(*)) will have their porn on Steam with two clicks instead. Lessons learned, other game devs will most likely follow that route. So the "one-click porn" thing lasted only for two days, long live the "two-click porn" thing! It is a lot better than the old "click, find the developer website, download patch, check how to patch, do the patch" thing.
[spoiler](*) Actually, the full list is closer to Australia (because of reasons mate), Russia (probably because of homo-sexual content?), Japan (pixels too small), South Korea (not enough Pylons) and China (because pornography is bad for you, get back to work peasant). And a big bunch of strongly Islamic countries which don't approve of human sexuality outside of procreation. And maybe a few countries that I missed. Germany is a bit of a special case here because porn is allowed, but Steam's age verification system doesn't meet the German standards. So technically, Germans could get it eventually. But Valve probably won't bother so... don't get your hopes up.[/spoiler]

Sooooo... yeah. All in all, in case it wasn't clear already, I really loved the game. As soon as the DLC bonus tidbits come off the first-week sale, I will certainly be buying them for full price. Take all my money, and thank you for the game.

Considering that, I personally think I got more than I purchased for).

The art is top notch just like before and definitely my favorite styles when it comes to VN's, followed by Starlight Vega's. Lots of general CG to appreciate, and the backgrounds are wonderfully detailed. While on topic, there is definitely Echhi galore! I'm not a fan of Het stuff (came for my lovable girl lovers, stayed for the story), but I appreciated it just as much. 

I'm never really a good judge with music since... I'm never really picky with it. As long as it fits the mood and helps give an idea to what the scene is meant to be, I'll think it's good enough. Love Stories does just that~

For the actual stories themselves, without spoiling:

I had a general idea of how Karen's would go but one particular ending had me go "Wow, didn't think of it that way". The actual ending was pleasant though, but it did have me go "saw that coming".... No innuendo intended.

Jasmin is my favorite from the original, so was very interested in hers. Getting to know her there though really helped get the intended ending on my first run through. Subsequent run throughs made me feel dirty (even if it might have been something I might have considered in real life) and I'm glad they weren't actually canon.

Oh my goodness, Charlotte. I do not have a good track record with Charlotte, but that's 100% my fault since I didn't even get to see her in my first playthrough in the original for... reasons ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) ... Her personal story though, by far, my favorite. It reminded me of my own relationship and the feels were had. It was a no brainer on how to get the best ending.. and I'm too scared to get any other ending. (Also, Mikka best girl of this game).

Sophie... haven't played Sophie yet. She wasn't personally my favorite, but she was still a fun character. If she's anything like she was in the original, I'm so sure the story will be wild~

All in all, definitely worth it, sale or not~!

Thank you Dharker Studio for continuing Negligee~! (Also sorry for the wall of text)

review:
I wish sometimes Steam had a middle ground when comes to reviewing things because this is how I feel after playing this, mixed. Not I will be upfront and say that this game having het content does not brother me that much since it is a prequel and Hannah is not the main character. So this review will judge the game on it merits as a prequel to the original game, not the fact it has het content.  Okay let's break it down. (Possible Spoilers) 
Storyline: So this visual novel is broke up into four stories each dealing with the three love intrests and the former manager of the shop, so it requires a look at all four. The stories are a little short and do use timeskips. I will start with my favorite that being Charlotte's which does a good enough job showing someone trying to make sense of their sexuality and dealing with unknown feelings for a close friend, it has some het because of that but it is nothing too crazy and the yuri made it worthwhile. Jasmin's story is the second one I like since it does a good job showing Jasmin being be level headed even in her situation, all the het stuff is completely opitional in this one so g about how you want but it is made clear she is a lesbian. Karen's story is middle of road and has a lot of romance stuff cliches loveless marraige, affair, and standoffs, the only thing that makes it standout was it wasn't afaird to show the conquences of all these things so it a soild okay. Sophia has my least liked story and it mostly due it  to being heavy on uncomfortable situations, one paritcular that is hard to watch...at the very least it does show what a person should to when in these situations and how to get of it when it goes to far so it still is okay. Upon getting each good ending you will get an epilogue showing what happened afterwards, all of which do their job wrapping up the stories. 
Artwork: The art is likely the strongest part to the game, minus a sprite change. The CGs are soild and work with what they are suppose to show storywise.
Music: It's fine  
Biggest Pro: It works as a prequel and the characters' good endings for the most part do pay off. Music fine
Biggest Con: Short, a lot of time skips and some uncomfortable scenes
Suggestion: If you want to play it play, if you hate the fact there is het then skip it. I myself do not regret playing it, just feel a little dissapointed with some elements. 
Overall I give it a middle ground recommdation

author: {'steamid': '76561198025322552', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1537005397}
review:
Okay then. So.. I'm gonna review each of the stories here individually as this the best way to get my thoughts out. 

Before that though, y'all had me confused looking at Hannah's updated artwork. I thought I was going crazy, but it just turns out she looks different in Love Stories than she did in Negligee. 

For Karen's Awakening: Man, the beginning hurt my soul. I got pretty sad. It explores a failed marriage(That isn't physically abusive, surprisingly) to the extent that Karen finds herself an affair while on the job and all forms of sex and some funny lines ensue. It's pretty cute overall, but it really gets serious at the end. You can figure that out yourself as that ending is pretty easy to get on a first run-through.
Her epilogue is kind of depressing, though. Especially with everything that happened to her. I'll give this epilogue a 4/5 cause it made me sad. 

For Jasmin's Stripping: This one doesn't hurt the soul too much, but you gotta feel for Jasmin. She makes it pretty clear that this isn't enjoyable of a profession, even with the money she's earning. So getting her canon ending that ties in with Negligee is pretty enjoyable. 
Her epilogue is just plain cute. 5/5 from me on that one. 

For Charlotte's First Love: Cinnamon Roll. That's all I got. It's a cinnamon roll story with some sin. 
Her epilogue is also cinnamon roll. Also a good ending. 5/5 on the score for this one. 

For Sophie's Temptation: I'll be honest, I forgot a lot of Sophie's story in Negligee, so seeing how she was portrayed in the beginning for this story really threw me off with her. Sex addicted and whatnot. But then I did a complete 180 when it got really bad for her to the extent she seeked out counseling. It was actually kinda rough to read on a personal level just due to the nature of the subject matter. Overall, I really liked Sophie's Temptation at the turning point, so 5/5 on this. 
Her epilogue is good, too. Spoilers, she goes back to school to pursue her dream. :D

Now for the general stuff:
Artwork: It's good, Hannah's art still throws me off, but that's it. Everything is top tier. 
Spelling: I think I only saw like.. two spelling errors? Nothing big or noticeable.
Music: It's okay. It's not repetitive, but it's also not memorable. The most memorable song was probably the one used in the epilogues. It just fit. 
Story: I've got no complaints with the story, there's always gonna be room for more story regardless of what you write... While the time leaps are a bit over-used, it's not something that I'd mark as negative. 

And that's it. Holy crap this is long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042764519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1536964060}
review:
Negligée: Love Stories is the prequel to the yuri game Negligée. It contains four short stories starring characters from that game, leading up to the events of Negligée.

For anyone who bought the original for the sweet yuri, this game is a slap in the face. All the characters engage in sex with men, and there is nothing sweet about it. In fact, there's a strong feeling (sometimes more than a feeling) of sexual assault throughout the game. Even in the rare instances where the girls enjoy what's happening, it's with a psychotic twist to it.

Dharker Studios have been fairly tasteful in most of their games, even the blatantly porny ones, but this one feels outright misogynistic. I get that these stories "explain" and portray why the characters are into women by the time we get to the original game (not that we ever needed such explanations), but saying that it's because they were involved in a lot of rapey scenarios with men is just insulting.

In any case, the stories are really just a string of uncomfortable sex scenes connected by thin story lines with no meat to them. Even Kopi Anget's wonderful art seems worse than usual, though I might attribute that to simply disliking the male characters.

My advice is to skip this one.

Play time to clear all paths: < 3 hours.
